column4: according to photobucket's site, they got hacked, and in order to see photobucket again you need to in windows type in ipconfig /flushdns, is there a way to flush the dns in linux?
i dont think it actually caches properly
basically, my inlaw's visited photobucket when it was being hacked, and they can't access it now
the dns needs to be flushed
And I have no idea how to do that
i think at most restarting firefox, are we talking like www.photobucket.com here?
change the dns server they're using
basically, they got hacked by some turkish hackers...
but in order to see the site again you gotta flush your dns...
I think the cache of the dns server they're using needs to get flushed...
